RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 1 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 65. Claiming Purse 12100. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: KHOPILOT was allowed to settle early on the inside, angled out three wide in the stretch closed determinedly and was up in the final strides. SMALL BUT FEISTY dueled on the lead throughout, held grudgingly and just missed. FISHING FOR FUN set the pace and dueled on the lead, held well in the stretch battle. AWESOME BREAK tracked three wide and went evenly late. RUBINSTEIN saved ground early, swung wide in the stretch and was no menace. PRETTY LOUD was unhurried early, and was no factor late BALI BEACH contended for a half, stopped on the far turn, stopped in the stretch and walked off

ENTRY.COMMENT: set the pace and dueled on the lead, held well in the stretch

ENTRY.NAME: Khopilot
ENTRY.COMMENT: was allowed to settle early on the inside, angled out three wide

ENTRY.NAME: Bali Beach
ENTRY.COMMENT: contended for a half, stopped on the far turn angled out, walked

ENTRY.NAME: Pretty Loud
ENTRY.COMMENT: was unhurried early, and was no factor,

ENTRY.NAME: Small But Feisty
ENTRY.COMMENT: dueled on the lead throughout, held grudgingly and just missed,

ENTRY.NAME: Awesome Break
ENTRY.COMMENT: tracked three wide and went evenly late

ENTRY.NAME: Rubinstein
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground early swung wide in the stretch and was no menace

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 2 6F Dirt CR: 77. Claiming Purse 14900. FOR FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500 (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: SILVER STICK STAIR dueled on the lead throughout, came again in deep stretch while between horses and prevailed late under strong handling. MYRRH dueled on the lead four wide, held grudgingly in the stretch drive and just missed. CALTHA dueled on the lead throughout, held well after a long stretch battle. TARA DAWN was never far back, angled in to the rail in the stretch and drew close, needed more late. RUN AWAY FEVER raced inside and lacked a late kick SABELLE dueled on the early lead and was through after a half.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 3 1M Dirt CR: 68. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR REGISTERED OHIO BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 15 Allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MOBIL CHIC pressed the early pace, rallied at the quarter pole and drew even, drew off late under mild urging. EMERSON JONES set the pace for three quarters, was no match for winner late but was second best. DIAMONDS N DEW tracked four wide and went evenly late. CAN I GO TOO was unhurried early, and was no menace late. LUCKY PENNY ROSE was allowed to settle early, swung wide stretch and was no threat. EASTER PRIDE had good position on the inside and had no rally. MY PINK BABY BIRD raced close up early and tired on the far turn.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 4 1M 70Y Dirt CR: 68. Maiden Claiming Purse 12200. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Claiming Price $7,500.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WHISKEY ROAN had good position early, rallied at the quarter pole three wide, closed determinedly and edged clear late. BON DEUX set the early pace, was hooked in the stretch and held stubbornly and was second best. ONE FOR THE MONEY raced mid pack early, rallied in the stretch and finished well on the inside. RESERVATION raced close up throughout and weakened slightly late. MY TWO AUNT JOANS was allowed to settle early, rallied on the far turn four wide, but in his bid and hung late SHEA D CAPTURE saved ground, and was no threat. JOHNNY'S MOMENT pressed the for six furlongs pace, then tired in the stretch. BAYTOWN BEAVER broke in air and trailed.

RACE.RACE_TEXT: MAHONING VALLEY RACE COURSE RACE 5 5 1/2F Dirt CR: 97. Claiming Purse 13000. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE OCTOBER 15. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000 (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In We ight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: DECEITFUL ANTHONY was away alertly and quickly made the lead, has hooked in the stretch, dug in gamely and prevailed. OVER THE HILLS chased the winner early, rallied in the stretch and drew close, could not get past the winner but held place. MONTAUK COVE tracked three wide and finished willingly. DONNELS CREEK raced mid pack and had no rally. CALL WEST was unhurried early and improved late while no threat. ASTRO JAK pressed the four pace and tired in the stretch. KHALFANI was unhurried early, swung wide in the stretch and was no threat. VALEROSO had brief foot and gave way.

RACE.FOOTNOTES: JOYFUL NOISE had good position on the inside, angled off the rail in the stretch, split horses and edged clear late under strong handling ROMANTIC JEWEL dueled on the lead throughout, finished well and was second best. ANCIENT BROWN was off slowly and trailed, rallied in the stretch five wide and closed fast. TALKBACK pressed the three wide pace and weakened slightly. GOLDEN LASSIE dueled early, shook clear on the turn, was hooked in mid stretch and weakened. CHARGAREE was unhurried early, swung wide in the stretch and was no threat. CASCABRIA saved ground and went evenly. MAVI raced close up, for a half, then tired. WILLYMAR contended early and tired in the lane. BELLA BASORA raced mid pack early, swung wide in the stretch and was outrun.

FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER OR OHIO BRED OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES OR ENTERED TO BE CLAIMED FOR $25,000. Three Year Olds, 119 lbs.; Older, 126 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Sin ce March 15 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $25,000 (Races Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances) (Ohio Registered Foals Preferred).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: THRU THE VINE was away alertly and dueled on the early lead, shook clear on the far turn, responded when asked and widened late under left handed urging RAISON KARTER raced mid pack early, rallied at the quarter pole and drew close, could not gain late on the winner but held place SO DIALED IN pressed the winner throughout and weakened slightly. SAINT GOAR raced four wide and had mild bid. CREDIT RIVER had good position on the inside and went evenly. CHIEF RANDEL contended for three quarters, then tired in the lane. TANTRUM allowed to settle, failed to menace. DISCLOSURE was outrun. The stewards posted the inquiry sign but took no action.

RACE.FOOTNOTES: PERFETTO was well placed, early, rallied at the quarter pole, split horse in the stretch and drew clear late under strong handling. ROYAL DRAGOON was unhurried early, rallied in the stretch five wide and closed fast to be second best. CLAW set the pace until mid stretch and weakened late.
